original: nyon mongs pa 'di dag rtogs pa'i phyir byang chub ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'di dag rtogs pa'i phyir byang chub ste /
translated: Because of realizing these afflictions, there is awakening.🔽The essence of the afflictions is also the essence of awakening.

original: nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid kyang de yin no zhes de 'di lta bur dran pa nye bar 'jog kyang ci'ang nye bar mi 'jog /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid kyang de yin no zhes de 'di lta bur dran pa nye bar 'jog kyang ci'ang nye bar mi 'jog /
translated: Even though he is mindful in this way, he does not place anything in mind,

original: rab tu mi 'jog /
analyzed: rab tu mi 'jog /
translated: does not place it well,

original: rnam par mi 'jog go /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'jog go /
translated: and does not place it at all.

original: chos nyid de gnas par rab tu shes te /
analyzed: chos nyid de gnas par rab tu shes te /
translated: He knows that reality is present.

original: de'i phyir chos kyi dbyings de gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kyi dbyings de gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that realm of reality is said to be present.

original: gnas @247b gang na chos kyi dbyings na gnas pa de na sems can gyi khams kyang gnas so //
analyzed: gnas @247b gang na chos kyi dbyings na gnas pa de na sems can gyi khams kyang gnas so //
translated: Wherever the realm of reality is present, the realm of sentient beings is also present.

original: sems can gyi khams gnas gang na gnas pa de na nam mkha'i khams kyang gnas te /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams gnas gang na gnas pa de na nam mkha'i khams kyang gnas te /
translated: Wherever the realm of sentient beings is present, the realm of space is also present.

original: de bas na chos thams cad ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are said to be like space.

original: chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la rton pa yin te /
analyzed: chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la rton pa yin te /
translated: “The bodhisattva who abides in the observation of phenomena in terms of phenomena relies on the qualities of the Buddha.

original: de chos thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos su mos so //
analyzed: de chos thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos su mos so //
translated: He is devoted to the Dharma of the Buddhas.

original: de zad pa shes pa'ang skyed mod 'dus byas kyang zad par mi byed de //
analyzed: de zad pa shes pa'ang skyed mod 'dus byas kyang zad par mi byed de //
translated: He produces the knowledge of extinction, but he does not cause the extinction of compounded things.

original: mi skye ba shes pa'ang mngon par sgrub ste /
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa'ang mngon par sgrub ste /
translated: He realizes the knowledge of non-production,

original: de sems can la lta ba'ang skyed cing mi skye ba'i mtha' yang mi spong ngo //
analyzed: de sems can la lta ba'ang skyed cing mi skye ba'i mtha' yang mi spong ngo //
translated: but he does not abandon the limit of non-production.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dran pa de la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dran pa de la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: The establishment of mindfulness of dharmas is the establishment of mindfulness in which all dharmas are established.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / chos su btags pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad dran pa de la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / chos su btags pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad dran pa de la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: All dharmas, whether of śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, or perfect buddhas, and all that is designated as Dharma, are established in that mindfulness.

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du'ang dran pa des mi brjed cing nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du'ang dran pa des mi brjed cing nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Up to the end of time, he does not forget or lose that mindfulness.

original: chos thams cad ma lus par dran pa de la gnas te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma lus par dran pa de la gnas te /
translated: He establishes all dharmas without exception in that mindfulness.

original: dran pa des phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du'ang mi brjed cing nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa des phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du'ang mi brjed cing nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By this mindfulness, they will not forget or lose it until the end of time.

original: chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba de ni tshad med pa shin tu @248a *//
analyzed: chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba de ni tshad med pa shin tu @248a *//
translated: “The mindfulness of the application of the observation of phenomena is a teaching that is immeasurable,

original: bstan pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: bstan pa'i tshig ste /
translated: a word of the teaching,

original: kun tu spyod yul ba /
analyzed: kun tu spyod yul ba /
translated: an object of activity,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba /
translated: the gathering of all the qualities of the buddhas,

original: sems can thams cad tshim par byed pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad tshim par byed pa /
translated: the satisfaction of all beings,

original: bdud thams cad pham par byed pa /
analyzed: bdud thams cad pham par byed pa /
translated: the defeat of all māras,

original: rang 'byung gi ye shes rtogs par byed pa'i tshig 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang 'byung gi ye shes rtogs par byed pa'i tshig 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and the realization of self-arisen wisdom.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi sgom pa mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi sgom pa mi zad pa'o //
translated: these are the bodhisatvas’ four applications of mindfulness, which are inexhaustible.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang dag par spong ba bzhi'ang mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang dag par spong ba bzhi'ang mi zad pa ste /
translated: Furthermore, the four correct endeavors of the bodhisattvas are also inexhaustible.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun bskyed /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun bskyed /
translated: In order to prevent the arising of non-virtuous factors that have not yet arisen, they generate enthusiasm,

original: 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: strive, and exert diligence.

original: sems rab tu 'dzin cing yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed /
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin cing yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed /
translated: In order to abandon non-virtuous factors that have already arisen, they generate enthusiasm,

original: 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: strive, and exert diligence.

original: sems rab tu 'dzin cing yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed /
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin cing yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed /
translated: In order to give rise to virtuous factors that have not yet arisen, they generate enthusiasm,

original: 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: strive, and exert diligence.

original: sems rab tu 'dzin cing yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa dang / dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / bsgom pa dang / phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / chud za bar mi 'gyur ba dang / @248b nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin cing yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa dang / dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / bsgom pa dang / phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / chud za bar mi 'gyur ba dang / @248b nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang /
translated: It is the mental factor that, in order to prevent the arising of non-virtuous factors that have not yet arisen, generates enthusiasm, strives, exerts effort, controls the mind, and focuses the mind.🔽It is the mental factor that, in order to abandon the non-virtuous factors that have arisen, generates enthusiasm, strives, exerts effort, controls the mind, and focuses the mind.🔽It is the mental factor that, in order to give rise to virtuous factors that have not yet arisen, generates enthusiasm, strives, exerts effort, controls the mind, and focuses the mind.

original: shin tu rgyas par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed /🔽'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: shin tu rgyas par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed / 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: It is the mental factor that, in order to maintain the virtuous factors that have arisen, cultivate them, increase them, and not let them diminish, generates enthusiasm, strives, exerts effort, controls the mind, and focuses the mind.

original: sems rab tu 'dzin cing yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin cing yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa'o //
translated: It is the mental factor that, in order to expand them, generates enthusiasm, strives, exerts effort, controls the mind, and focuses the mind.🔽It is the mental factor that, in order to prevent the arising of non-virtuous factors that have not yet arisen, generates enthusiasm, strives, exerts effort, controls the mind, and focuses the mind.🔽It is the mental factor that, in order to abandon the non-virtuous factors that have arisen, generates enthusiasm, strives, exerts effort, controls the mind, and focuses the mind.

original: gang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed ces bya ba de ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: gang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed ces bya ba de ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: It is the mental factor that, in order to give rise to virtuous factors that have not yet arisen, generates enthusiasm, strives, exerts effort, controls the mind, and focuses the mind.🔽It is the mental factor that, in order to maintain the virtuous factors that have arisen, cultivate them, increase them, and not let them diminish, generates enthusiasm, strives, exerts effort, controls the mind, and focuses the mind.

original: 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom zhes bya ba de ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa mi 'dor ba'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom zhes bya ba de ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa mi 'dor ba'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: It is the mental factor that, in order to expand them, generates enthusiasm, strives, exerts effort, controls the mind, and focuses the mind.

original: sems rab tu 'dzin cing yang dag par rab tu 'jog ces bya ba de ni tshul bzhin du rtog pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin cing yang dag par rab tu 'jog ces bya ba de ni tshul bzhin du rtog pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: “To hold the mind in check and to settle it correctly” is a synonym for proper investigation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshul bzhin rab tu sbyor ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams kun tu mi spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin rab tu sbyor ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams kun tu mi spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one who is properly engaged does not engage in sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: de la sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas?

original: gang 'di tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: gang 'di tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: They are the counteragents to morality, the counteragents to samādhi, and the counteragents to wisdom.

original: de la tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na /
translated: What are the counteragents to morality?

original: gang 'di tshul khrims nyams pa dang / gang dag gzhan gyi tshul khrims kyang nyams par byed pa'i chos ci'ang rung ste /
analyzed: gang 'di tshul khrims nyams pa dang / gang dag gzhan gyi tshul khrims kyang nyams par byed pa'i chos ci'ang rung ste /
translated: Any dharmas whatsoever that are a decline in morality, or that cause a decline in the morality of others,

original: gang dag tshul khrims kyi phung po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ba 'di ni tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag tshul khrims kyi phung po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ba 'di ni tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is a counteragent to the aggregate of morality is called the counteragent to morality.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the counteragent to the aggregate of meditation?

original: gang 'di cho ga nyams pa ste /🔽gang dag gzhan gyi sems kyang rnam @249a *//
analyzed: gang 'di cho ga nyams pa ste / gang dag gzhan gyi sems kyang rnam @249a *//
translated: It is the degeneration of ritual.

original: par g-yeng bar byed pa'i chos ci'ang rung ste /
analyzed: par g-yeng bar byed pa'i chos ci'ang rung ste /
translated: It is any phenomenon that causes the minds of others to be distracted.

original: gang dag ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ba 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ba 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is a counteragent to the aggregate of meditation is called the counteragent to meditation.

original: de la shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the counteragent to the aggregate of wisdom?

original: gang 'di lta ba nyams pa ste /🔽gang dag gzhan gyi lta ba'ang nyams par byed pa /
analyzed: gang 'di lta ba nyams pa ste / gang dag gzhan gyi lta ba'ang nyams par byed pa /
translated: It is the degeneration of view.🔽It is any phenomenon that causes the views of others to degenerate,

original: kun nas ldang ba dang; sgrib pa dang / chod par 'gyur ba'i chos ci'ang rung ste /
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba dang; sgrib pa dang / chod par 'gyur ba'i chos ci'ang rung ste /
translated: that causes agitation, obscuration, and obstruction.

original: gang dag shes rab kyi phung po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur pa 'di ni shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag shes rab kyi phung po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur pa 'di ni shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ste /
translated: The factors that are adverse to the aggregate of wisdom are called the “adverse factors of wisdom.”

original: 'di ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called “evil, unwholesome dharmas.”

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa gang gis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos 'di lta bu ma skyes pa rnams mi skye ba'i go skabs mi 'byed pa 'di ni yang dag par spong ba dang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa gang gis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos 'di lta bu ma skyes pa rnams mi skye ba'i go skabs mi 'byed pa 'di ni yang dag par spong ba dang po zhes bya'o //
translated: The proper mental attention by which one does not allow an opportunity for the arising of such evil, unwholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen is called the “first right exertion.”

original: gang yang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed /
analyzed: gang yang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed /
translated: Moreover, in order to abandon those evil, unwholesome dharmas that have arisen, one generates enthusiasm,

original: 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: exerts effort,🔽stimulates one’s mind, and strives with correct mental exertion.

original: sems rab tu 'dzin cing yang dag par rab tu 'jog ces bya ba de ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin cing yang dag par rab tu 'jog ces bya ba de ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: This is called “proper mental attention.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag sems la phung por gyur pa med de /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag sems la phung por gyur pa med de /
translated: Those evil, unwholesome dharmas do not exist in the mind as a real entity.

original: yul na mi gnas phyogs na mi gnas shing gdags par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul na mi gnas phyogs na mi gnas shing gdags par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist in the object, it does not exist in the direction, and it cannot be designated.

original: gang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag sems la kun tu 'byung @249b ba spong pa zhes pa ni rgyu dang dmigs pa gang dag gis sdug ba'i rnam par 'dod chags sam /
analyzed: gang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag sems la kun tu 'byung @249b ba spong pa zhes pa ni rgyu dang dmigs pa gang dag gis sdug ba'i rnam par 'dod chags sam /
translated: “ Abandoning the arising of evil, unwholesome dharmas in the mind” means that, through whatever causes and objects, desire arises in the form of attachment,

original: khong khro ba'i rnam par zhe sdang ngam /
analyzed: khong khro ba'i rnam par zhe sdang ngam /
translated: aversion arises in the form of anger,

original: ma rig pa'i rnam par gti mug skye ba'ang rung ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rnam par gti mug skye ba'ang rung ste /
translated: or delusion arises in the form of ignorance,

original: de dag la mi sdug pa'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pas ni 'dod chags zhi bar byed /
analyzed: de dag la mi sdug pa'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pas ni 'dod chags zhi bar byed /
translated: through the proper mental application of the method of repulsiveness, one pacifies desire;

original: byams pas ni zhe sdang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pas ni gti mug zhi bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: byams pas ni zhe sdang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pas ni gti mug zhi bar byed pa ste /
translated: through loving kindness, one pacifies anger; and through engaging with dependent origination, one pacifies delusion.

original: gang nyon mongs pa 'di dag zhi ba 'di ni spong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang nyon mongs pa 'di dag zhi ba 'di ni spong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This pacification of the afflictions is called “abandonment.”

original: tha snyad btags pa gzung gi don dam par na de la gang spang ba'i chos gang yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: tha snyad btags pa gzung gi don dam par na de la gang spang ba'i chos gang yang mi dmigs te /
translated: It is a conventional designation. Ultimately, no dharma to be abandoned is observed there.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mngon sum pas na /
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mngon sum pas na /
translated: Because all dharmas are directly perceived as sameness.

original: de'i phyir yang dag par spong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag par spong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called “correct abandonment.”

original: 'di ni yang dag par spong ba gnyis pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag par spong ba gnyis pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the second correct abandonment.

original: gang yang dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed /
analyzed: gang yang dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed /
translated: “In order to generate wholesome states that have not yet arisen, one generates enthusiasm,

original: 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: strives, arouses energy,🔽takes hold of one’s mind, and correctly makes it strive.”

original: sems rab tu 'dzin cing yang dag par rab tu 'jog ces bya ba de ni tshad med pa'i tshig shin tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin cing yang dag par rab tu 'jog ces bya ba de ni tshad med pa'i tshig shin tu bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the word “boundless.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang dag byang chub sems dpas yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de dag tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag byang chub sems dpas yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de dag tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the qualities that are to be accomplished by the bodhisattvas are boundless.

original: de la 'dun pa ni dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa ni dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba'o //
translated: Here, enthusiasm is the root of all wholesome states.

original: brtson 'grus ni dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa'o //
translated: Energy is the accomplishment of all wholesome states.

original: sems yang dag par 'dzin pas ni dge ba'i chos thams cad nyams su lon par byed de /
analyzed: sems yang dag par 'dzin pas ni dge ba'i chos thams cad nyams su lon par byed de /
translated: By taking hold of the mind, one experiences all wholesome states.

original: dge ba'i chos de dag la dpyod @250a *//
analyzed: dge ba'i chos de dag la dpyod @250a *//
translated: One examines those wholesome states.

original: cing rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: cing rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: and it is the thorough analysis of that.

original: 'di ni yang dag par spong ba gsum pa zhes bya'o //

original: dga' ba la gzhog pa dang / btang snyoms sgom pa dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang /
analyzed: dga' ba la gzhog pa dang / btang snyoms sgom pa dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang /
translated: It is the cultivation of joy, equanimity, the first concentration, the second concentration, the third concentration, the fourth concentration, the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness,

original: ci'ang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa mthar gyis snyoms par 'jug pa dgu po 'di dag ni zhi gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ci'ang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa mthar gyis snyoms par 'jug pa dgu po 'di dag ni zhi gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: the sphere of nothingness, the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, the cessation of perception and feeling, and the nine successive abodes.

original: 'di ltar zhi gnas kyi tshogs ni tshad med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhi gnas kyi tshogs ni tshad med pa ste /
translated: Thus, the accumulation of tranquility is immeasurable.

original: zhi gnas kyi tshogs de dag la gang brtson pa 'di ni zhi gnas mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi tshogs de dag la gang brtson pa 'di ni zhi gnas mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who strive in that accumulation of tranquility are said to have inexhaustible tranquility.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag mthong mi zad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag mthong mi zad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ inexhaustible insight?

original: gang shes rab kyi cha dang mthun pa sgom pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi cha dang mthun pa sgom pa'i lam ste /
translated: It is the path of cultivation that is in accord with wisdom.

original: chos rnams la g-yo ba med par shes pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gso ba med pa dang / gang zag med par shes pa dang / phung po rnams la sgyu mar mthong ba'i shes pa dang /
analyzed: chos rnams la g-yo ba med par shes pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gso ba med pa dang / gang zag med par shes pa dang / phung po rnams la sgyu mar mthong ba'i shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know that phenomena are without movement. It is to know that there is no self, no sentient beings, no life force, no nourishment, and no individuals. It is to know that the aggregates are like an illusion.

original: khams rnams la sbrul gdug pa lta bur @258b mthong ba'i shes pa dang / skye mched rnams la grong stong pa lta bur mthong pa'i shes pa dang / bden pa rnams la shin tu rtogs par mthong ba'i shes pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang mi 'gal bar mthong ba'i shes pa dang /
analyzed: khams rnams la sbrul gdug pa lta bur @258b mthong ba'i shes pa dang / skye mched rnams la grong stong pa lta bur mthong pa'i shes pa dang / bden pa rnams la shin tu rtogs par mthong ba'i shes pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang mi 'gal bar mthong ba'i shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know that the elements are like poisonous snakes. It is to know that the sense sources are like an empty town. It is to know that the truths are to be fully realized. It is to know that dependent origination is not contradictory.

original: lta ba thams cad dang bral bar mthong ba'i shes pa dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa chud mi za bar mthong ba'i shes pa dang / 'bras bu 'thob pa mngon sum du bya ba la nges par mthong ba'i shes pa dang /
analyzed: lta ba thams cad dang bral bar mthong ba'i shes pa dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa chud mi za bar mthong ba'i shes pa dang / 'bras bu 'thob pa mngon sum du bya ba la nges par mthong ba'i shes pa dang /
translated: the cognition that sees the absence of all views, the cognition that sees the non-wastage of causes, effects, and ripening, the cognition that sees the certainty of attaining the result,🔽and the cognition that sees the engagement with reality.

original: yang dag pa nyid la 'jug pa mthong ba'i shes pa ni lhag mthong zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid la 'jug pa mthong ba'i shes pa ni lhag mthong zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called insight.

original: lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni chos rnams yang dag par mthong ba'o //🔽chos rnams ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni chos rnams yang dag par mthong ba'o // chos rnams ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'o //
translated: Insight is the correct seeing of phenomena.🔽It is seeing phenomena as they are.

original: chos rnams de kho na nyid du mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos rnams de kho na nyid du mthong ba'o //
translated: It is seeing phenomena as they really are.

original: chos rnams gzhan ma yin pa nyid du mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos rnams gzhan ma yin pa nyid du mthong ba'o //
translated: It is seeing phenomena as they are not.

original: chos rnams stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos rnams stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med par mthong ba'o //
translated: It is seeing phenomena as empty, signless, and wishless.

original: chos rnams mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / de bzhin du ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / dngos po med pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin dang / rnam par dag pa dang / dben par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos rnams mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / de bzhin du ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / dngos po med pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin dang / rnam par dag pa dang / dben par mthong ba'o //
translated: It is to see phenomena as unconditioned, and likewise as unborn, unarisen, insubstantial, as they are, as pure, and as secluded.

original: chos rnams g-yo ba med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / bdag po med pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / dbyer med cing ro gcig pa dang / nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos rnams g-yo ba med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / bdag po med pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / dbyer med cing ro gcig pa dang / nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das par mthong ba'o //
translated: It is to see phenomena as unmoving, inactive, without a master, without a possessor, indivisible, of one taste, of the nature of space, and naturally in a state of nirvāṇa.

original: lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i rnam par yang mi mthong /🔽med pa'i rnam @259a *//
analyzed: lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i rnam par yang mi mthong / med pa'i rnam @259a *//
translated: “Insight” means not seeing existence,

original: par yang mi mthong /
analyzed: par yang mi mthong /
translated: not seeing nonexistence,🔽not seeing arising,🔽not seeing cessation,

original: skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa'i rnam par yang mi mthong /
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa'i rnam par yang mi mthong /
translated: not seeing abiding,🔽not seeing objects,

original: dmigs pa dang / mtshan ma'i rnam par yang mi mthong ba ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / mtshan ma'i rnam par yang mi mthong ba ste /
translated: and not seeing characteristics.

original: de mthong mod kyi ci'ang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de mthong mod kyi ci'ang mi mthong ngo //
translated: It is seeing without seeing anything at all.

original: gang gis tshe mthong ba med pa de'i tshe mthong ste /🔽lhag mthong gis kyang mthong ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: gang gis tshe mthong ba med pa de'i tshe mthong ste / lhag mthong gis kyang mthong ba'ang ma yin /
translated: When one does not see, then one sees.🔽One sees neither by insight nor by non-insight.

original: ma mthong ba'ang ma yin par mthong ngo //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'ang ma yin par mthong ngo //
translated: One sees by not seeing.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar mthong ba de'i tshe yang dag pa nyid mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar mthong ba de'i tshe yang dag pa nyid mthong ngo //
translated: When one sees in this way, then one sees reality.

original: yang dag pa nyid mthong bas lhag mthong la mkhas pas thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid mthong bas lhag mthong la mkhas pas thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By seeing reality, one attains skill in insight.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' lhag mthong gis de ltar mthong yang mngon par 'du mi byed par yang mi ltung zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du byed pa las kyang mi ldang ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' lhag mthong gis de ltar mthong yang mngon par 'du mi byed par yang mi ltung zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du byed pa las kyang mi ldang ste /
translated: Although the bodhisattva sees in this way through insight, he does not fall into non-performance and does not rise up from the performance of the roots of virtue.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag mthong mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag mthong mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattvas’ imperishable insight.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong mi zad pa'o //
translated: these are the bodhisattvas’ imperishable calm abiding and insight.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gzungs dang / spobs pa mi zad pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gzungs dang / spobs pa mi zad pa yin te /
translated: Furthermore, the bodhisattvas have inexhaustible mnemonic powers and eloquence.

original: de la gzungs mi zad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzungs mi zad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is meant by inexhaustible mnemonic powers?

original: gzungs zhes bya ba ni gang sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs bsags pa; dran pas chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong 'dzin pa dang / kun 'dzin pa dang / mi brjed pa dang / dran pas yang dag par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: gzungs zhes bya ba ni gang sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs bsags pa; dran pas chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong 'dzin pa dang / kun 'dzin pa dang / mi brjed pa dang / dran pas yang dag par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Mnemonics means to retain, to hold, not to forget, and to correctly hold in memory the eighty-four thousand bundles of Dharma that one has previously accumulated through the roots of virtue and mindfulness.

original: 'di ni gzungs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzungs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called mnemonics.

original: yang @259b gzungs zhes bya ba ni gang gis sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa kun tu 'dzin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / nyan thos thams cad dang / sems can thams cad kyis smras pa kun tu 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: yang @259b gzungs zhes bya ba ni gang gis sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa kun tu 'dzin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / nyan thos thams cad dang / sems can thams cad kyis smras pa kun tu 'dzin pa dang /
translated: Moreover, mnemonics means to retain all that is spoken by all the buddhas, all the bodhisattvas, all the pratyekabuddhas, all the śrāvakas, and all sentient beings.

original: legs par smras pa thams cad ma lus par kun tu 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: legs par smras pa thams cad ma lus par kun tu 'dzin pa ste /
translated: It means to retain all that is well spoken without exception.

original: 'di ni gzungs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzungs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called mnemonics.

original: gang gi tshe bskal pa gzhan du brjes par gyur tam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bskal pa gzhan du brjes par gyur tam /

translated: The method is the attainment of the miracles of the Tathāgata through the knowledge of miraculous activity.

analyzed: thabs ni sems can dag gi bsam pa rnams la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The method is to engage in the thoughts of sentient beings.

original: zhugs nas kyang brgal ba'o //
analyzed: zhugs nas kyang brgal ba'o //

analyzed: thabs ni nyon mongs pa med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The method is to be without afflictions and yet to be fully afflicted.

original: thabs ni khur bor nas khur khyer ba'o //
analyzed: thabs ni khur bor nas khur khyer ba'o //

analyzed: thabs ni tshad yod pa tshad med par ston pa'o // thabs ni tshad @263a *//

analyzed: med pa tshad yod par ston pa'o //

analyzed: thabs ni dbang po zhen pa rnams la gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: The method is to clarify for those who are attached to the faculties.

analyzed: thabs ni dus dang / dus ma yin pa shes pa'o //

original: mang po las tshad med par byed do //
analyzed: mang po las tshad med par byed do //

analyzed: thabs ni bye ba'i sems can rnams 'dum par byed do //
